Title: William was at his ‘lowest’ after Kate’s cancer diagnosis – former royal aide
Paragraphs: ['A former aide to the Prince of Wales said he was at his “lowest” after the Princess of Wales was diagnosed with cancer.', 'Jason Knauf was formerly chief executive of William and Kate’s Royal Foundation, stepping down at the end of 2021, and also previously worked for the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.', 'Both the King and the Princess of Wales were treated for cancer last year. Kate is now in remission and Charles is having ongoing treatment.', 'In an interview with 60 Minutes Australia, Mr Knauf said: “Within a couple of weeks, if you’re Prince William, you find out that both your wife and your father have cancer. I couldn’t believe it.”', "It was awful, absolutely awful. It's the lowest I've ever seen him", 'Describing a phone call with William about Kate’s diagnosis, which was made public in March last year, Mr Knauf said: “It was awful, absolutely awful. It’s the lowest I’ve ever seen him.', '“But the problem was that all this crazy conspiracy theory stuff kicked off in the background, online. ‘Was she really ill?’.', '“But they didn’t want to say yet that she had cancer because they hadn’t told the children and they were still working through how to tell the children.”', 'Mr Knauf said what he used to talk about the “most” in the past with William was “how he and the princess were going to prepare their children for life in the public eye”.', 'He added: “His childhood in front of the media was quite difficult at times, and he knew that he was going to be raising his kids to deal with social media and mobile phones and all of that stuff.”', 'In October 2018, while working for the Duke and Duchess of Sussex as their communications secretary, Mr Knauf made a bullying complaint against Meghan – emailing his concerns to William’s then private secretary, in an apparent attempt to force Buckingham Palace to protect staff.', 'The duchess’s legal team strenuously denied the allegation.', 'Discussing William’s relationship with Harry, Mr Knauf said: “It’s very difficult to have this stuff play out in the public eye, but he’s chosen to keep his thoughts on it private, and I think all of us who know him really have to respect that we should do the same.', '“But I will say, of course, it’s been hard and sad, especially for all of us who know both of them.”', 'Mr Knauf was made a Lieutenant of the Royal Victorian Order (RVO) in the 2023 New Year Honours List.', 'Before joining the royal household the American-born former corporate affairs executive worked for a range of institutions, from the office of the New Zealand prime minister to HM Treasury and the Royal Bank of Scotland.', 'Mr Knauf led a review of the Royal Foundation’s role and structure from March 2019, before becoming its chief executive in September of that year.', 'He oversaw the launch of the Foundation’s Earthshot Prize – William’s £50 million environmental prize, now an independent charity, which recognises solutions, ideas and technologies that “repair the planet”.', '', '', "This website and associated newspapers adhere to the Title: Prince William ‘lowest I have ever seen him’ after Kate’s cancer diagnosis, says ex-aide
Paragraphs: ['Jason Knauf was interviewed for an Australian documentary, and also spoke about the rift with Prince Harry', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Prince William was the “lowest I have ever seen him” after the Princess of Wales was diagnosed with cancer, one of his closest former aides has said.', 'Jason Knauf, a former chief executive of the Prince and Princess of Wales’ Royal Foundation, said the phone call in which he learned of the Princess’s illness was “awful, absolutely awful”.', 'The situation was compounded, he suggested, by “all this crazy conspiracy theory stuff” on social media, where members of the public speculated about the whereabouts of the Princess before she had even decided how to tell her children.', 'In an interview with 60 Minutes Australia for a documentary about the Prince, Mr Knauf said: “Within a couple of weeks, if you’re Prince William, you find out that both your wife and your father have cancer. I couldn’t believe it.”', 'Describing a phone call about the diagnosis, which was made public in March last year, Mr Knauf said: “It was awful, absolutely awful. It’s the lowest I’ve ever seen him.', '“But the problem was that all this crazy conspiracy theory stuff kicked off in the background, online. ‘Was she really ill?’.', '“But they didn’t want to say yet that she had cancer because they hadn’t told the children and they were still working through how to tell the children.”', 'Mr Knauf, who formerly worked as press secretary for the Waleses and the Sussexes, said his conversations with Prince William were dominated by “how he and the princess were going to prepare their children for life in the public eye”.', 'He added: “His childhood in front of the media was quite difficult at times, and he knew that he was going to be raising his kids to deal with social media and mobile phones and all of that stuff.', '“I definitely saw the worried mum and dad behind the scenes, but a lot less in recent years, which has been fantastic for them as a family.”', 'Mr Knauf found himself briefly in the public eye in 2020, after details of an internal palace complaint he made two years earlier - raising concerns about the behaviour of the Duchess of Sussex- came to light. He also submitted written evidence to the Duchess’s court case against the Mail on Sunday.', 'He said the unwanted public attention had been “tough”, but that people “can’t choose just to take the fun stuff in any job”.', 'Answering a question about Prince William’s relationship with Prince Harry, Mr Knauf said: “It’s very difficult to have this stuff play out in the public eye, but he’s chosen to keep his thoughts on it private, and I think all of us who know him really have to respect that we should do the same.', '“But I will say, of course, it’s been hard and sad, especially for all of us who know both of them.” On William’s beard, he added: “I love it. I think it’s great. But ah, I’ve talked to him about it or tried to talk to him about it. He’s like, ‘It’s here. I have a beard. No further conversation’”.', 'On whether Catherine likes it, he added: “If she didn’t like it, it wouldn’t be there. I could tell you that!”', 'Mr Knauf was made a Lieutenant of the Royal Victorian Order (RVO) in the 2023 New Year Honours List.', 'Before joining the royal household, the American-born former corporate affairs executive worked for a range of institutions, from the office of the New Zealand prime minister to HM Treasury and the Royal Bank of Scotland.', 'Mr Knauf led a review of the Royal Foundation’s role and structure from March 2019, before becoming its chief executive in September of that year.', 'He oversaw the launch of the Foundation’s Earthshot Prize – William’s £50 million environmental prize, now an independent charity, which recognises solutions, ideas and technologies that “repair the planet”.', 'The 60 Minutes documentary, called Where There’s a Will, is available on Australia’s Channel 9.', '', '', '', '', '']

Title: William at his lowest after Kate's diagnosis, says ex-aide
Prince William was 'at his lowest' after wife's cancer diagnosis, says former aide
Paragraphs: ['', "In a candid chat with '60 Minutes Australia', Jason Knauf, former aide to the Prince of Wales, reflected on a tumultuous period when both the King and the Princess of Wales were diagnosed with cancer.", 'Knauf, who stepped down as CEO of William and Kate\'s Royal Foundation at the end of 2021 and also worked with Harry and Meghan, shared his disbelief at the time, saying: "Within a couple of weeks, if you\'re Prince William, you find out that both your wife and your father have cancer. I couldn\'t believe it."', 'He recounted an especially somber moment discussing Kate\'s condition, which was publicly revealed in March last year: "It was awful, absolutely awful. It\'s the lowest I\'ve ever seen him."', 'Knauf mentioned the added strain of rampant online speculation: "But the problem was that all this crazy conspiracy theory stuff kicked off in the background, online. \'Was she really ill? \'."', '"But they didn\'t want to say yet that she had cancer because they hadn\'t told the children and they were still working through how to tell the children."', 'He disclosed that discussions about helping William and the princess prepare their children for public scrutiny used to dominate his conversations with the prince: "His childhood in front of the media was quite difficult at times, and he knew that he was going to be raising his kids to deal with social media and mobile phones and all of that stuff."', "In October 2018, while serving as the communications secretary for the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Mr Knauf lodged a complaint alleging bullying by Meghan, sending an email to Prince William's then private secretary in what seemed to be an effort to prompt Buckingham Palace into safeguarding its staff. The duchess's legal representatives have vigorously refuted these claims.", 'Reflecting on the strain between Princes William and Harry, Mr Knauf remarked: "It\'s very difficult to have this stuff play out in the public eye, but he\'s chosen to keep his thoughts on it private, and I think all of us who know him really have to respect that we should do the same." He added, "But I will say, of course, it\'s been hard and sad, especially for all of us who know both of them."', 'Keep up to date with all the latest breaking news and top stories from the North East with our free newsletter', 'For his service, Mr Knauf was appointed a Lieutenant of the Royal Victorian Order (RVO) in the 2023 New Year Honours List. Title: Prince William was at his 'lowest' on phone call after Kate Middleton's cancer news
Paragraphs: ['A former royal aide has revealed Prince William was at "the lowest I\'ve ever seen him" after being told Kate Middleton had been diagnosed with cancer.', 'The Princess of Wales was diagnosed with an unspecified type of cancer last year and subsequently underwent chemotherapy treatment. She was supported by her family throughout and is now in remission.', "Jason Knauf, who worked for William and Kate from 2015 until 2021, has shared how he found out about Kate's cancer diagnosis. The ex royal aide appeared on a new documentary for 60 Minutes Australia and said William told him the news over the phone.", 'Speaking in the documentary, Knauf said William was at his "lowest" during the call. "Within a couple of weeks if you\'re Prince William, you find out that both your wife and your father have cancer," Knauf said.', 'He added, "I couldn\'t believe it. It was awful, absolutely awful. It\'s the lowest I\'ve ever seen him." He also slammed the speculation that followed when Kate stepped back from her royal duties.', '"The problem was that all this crazy conspiracy theory stuff kicked off in the background online," Knauf recalled. "Was she really ill?"', 'He revealed the reason William and Kate initially kept quiet about her diagnosis. "They didn\'t want to say yet that she had cancer because they hadn\'t told the children and they were still working through how to tell the children," he explained.', "Kate isn't the only royal family member who was diagnosed with cancer. King Charles was also diagnosed with an unspecified type of cancer and is undergoing treatment.", 'William has previously opened up about the health struggles, saying it\'s been a "brutal" time for his family. He made the comments during a visit to Cape Town. He said his wife was "doing really well" after completing her chemotherapy treatment and said she has been "amazing" throughout her health struggles.', 'Speaking ahead of the Earthshot Prize 2024, William said: "She\'s doing really well thanks. And hopefully she is watching tonight. Cheering me on. She\'s been amazing this whole this whole year."', 'He added, "I know she will be really keen to see tonight be a success." Title: William was at his ‘lowest’ after Kate’s cancer diagnosis – former royal aide
Paragraphs: ['A former aide to the Prince of Wales said he was at his “lowest” after the Princess of Wales was diagnosed with cancer.', 'Jason Knauf was formerly chief executive of William and Kate’s Royal Foundation, stepping down at the end of 2021, and also previously worked for the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.', 'Both the King and the Princess of Wales were treated for cancer last year. Kate is now in remission and Charles is having ongoing treatment.', 'In an interview with 60 Minutes Australia, Mr Knauf said: “Within a couple of weeks, if you’re Prince William, you find out that both your wife and your father have cancer. I couldn’t believe it.”', "It was awful, absolutely awful. It's the lowest I've ever seen him", 'Describing a phone call with William about Kate’s diagnosis, which was made public in March last year, Mr Knauf said: “It was awful, absolutely awful. It’s the lowest I’ve ever seen him.', '“But the problem was that all this crazy conspiracy theory stuff kicked off in the background, online. ‘Was she really ill?’.', '“But they didn’t want to say yet that she had cancer because they hadn’t told the children and they were still working through how to tell the children.”', 'Mr Knauf said what he used to talk about the “most” in the past with William was “how he and the princess were going to prepare their children for life in the public eye”.', 'He added: “His childhood in front of the media was quite difficult at times, and he knew that he was going to be raising his kids to deal with social media and mobile phones and all of that stuff.”', 'In October 2018, while working for the Duke and Duchess of Sussex as their communications secretary, Mr Knauf made a bullying complaint against Meghan – emailing his concerns to William’s then private secretary, in an apparent attempt to force Buckingham Palace to protect staff.', 'The duchess’s legal team strenuously denied the allegation.', 'Discussing William’s relationship with Harry, Mr Knauf said: “It’s very difficult to have this stuff play out in the public eye, but he’s chosen to keep his thoughts on it private, and I think all of us who know him really have to respect that we should do the same.', '“But I will say, of course, it’s been hard and sad, especially for all of us who know both of them.”', 'Mr Knauf was made a Lieutenant of the Royal Victorian Order (RVO) in the 2023 New Year Honours List.', 'Before joining the royal household the American-born former corporate affairs executive worked for a range of institutions, from the office of the New Zealand prime minister to HM Treasury and the Royal Bank of Scotland.', 'Mr Knauf led a review of the Royal Foundation’s role and structure from March 2019, before becoming its chief executive in September of that year.', 'He oversaw the launch of the Foundation’s Earthshot Prize – William’s £50 million
